summary: Removes the constant rumbling wind sound cause ears aren't microphones.
descriptionHtml:
For some reason, Skyrim is cluttered with noise. Followers talk, bark and howl every three seconds, Dungeons sound like orchestra training grounds, even cobwebs make a sound when you slash through them. At least you can mute the music. It's as if the developers want to remind us incessantly that the world is alive by not giving us a moment of silence - while for some reason they muffled natural sounds like waterfalls to the point of where you can stand next to a waterfall and hear the ambient wind sound OVER the thundering water.

However, that is the wind sound as a microphone records it. It's not what you really hear when you're in a forest or on a mountain. Wind isn't a constant rumbling noise pollution, it's a swishing sound in the grass or a whisper in the trees.

I have muted almost every ambient wind sound I could find. Now you can stand in the tundra and actually hear other sounds in the distance.

It's a simple mod, no esp, I just used Audacity to mute the sound files. I also replaced the snowfall sound with the sound of a real snowfall, which is a very quiet icy tingling sound, not a howling rumble (unless you're out in a snowstorm). I left the storm sounds untouched and I can't find a particular rumbling soundfile, so you may still hear the occasional microphone sound.

[b]Install: [/b]

Use NMM or MO and activate it.

The mod only influences wind soundfiles in sound\fx\amb\ and sound\fx\ambr. All others remain untouched.

[b]Compatibility:[/b]

No DLC required because I didn't touch any DLC content.

This works well with [url=http://www.nexusmods.com/skyrim/mods/43773/?]Audio Overhaul For Skyrim 2[/url].

Load my mod after other audio mods.

[b]Incompatibility:[/b]

Any mod that modifies wind soundfiles in sound\fx\amb\ or sound\fx\ambr. Place my mod at the end of your load order to keep it from being overwritten.

[b]Credits:[/b]

Bethesda for the game.
www.freesound.org and www.soundbible.com for the snowfall soundfiles.
